description: Known as the 'King of Mangoes', Alphonso mangoes are prized for their rich, creamy, saffron-colored pulp and exquisite aroma. Grown in the Konkan region of Maharashtra, these mangoes are seasonal and available from April to June.
Premium long-grain Basmati rice known for its distinctive aroma and fluffy texture when cooked. Ideal for biryanis, pulao, and other Indian rice dishes. Aged for minimum 1 year for enhanced flavor.
Gir Kesar mangoes are known for their bright orange pulp and sweet-tangy flavor. These mangoes are grown in the foothills of Gir forest and are rich in antioxidants and vitamins.
India's most trusted butter brand. Made from fresh milk, Amul butter is rich in taste and perfect for cooking, baking or spreading on bread. Contains no artificial colors or preservatives.
First flush Darjeeling tea leaves, known as the 'Champagne of Teas'. Grown in the Himalayan foothills, this tea has a delicate aroma and light color with a distinctive muscatel flavor.
Crisp and juicy apples grown in the orchards of Himachal Pradesh. These apples have a perfect balance of sweetness and tartness, making them ideal for both eating fresh and cooking.
